entry.title: Production Material Staging with Batch Characteristics
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am working on Production Material Staging (PMR) in SAP EWM.

Scenario:

  • Production Order is created in SAP S/4HANA

  • PMR is generated in SAP EWM

  • Staging is triggered from the PMR

During staging, the system should select batches based on specific batch characteristics (for example: quality parameters, production date, or custom batch characteristics), and stage only those batches that match the defined criteria.

As of now we are doing manually, is there any standard configuration where system can select batches based on the certain characteristics.

Regards,

Chand.

This is a SQL Server based report and I have only tried OLEDB ADO.

entry.title: Re: Issue with Cross-Order Staging Determination During P...
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I have got the reason for this behavior. This is standard system behavior. When the manufacturing order has a batch or batch selection criteria, and cross-order staging is used, the system treats it as single-order staging. Accordingly, in the PMR, the system sets the STAGING_METHOD to â€˜3â€™ (Single Order Only).

Also, SAP providing two BAdi related to this, /SCWM/EX_MFG_STAGE_METHOD and /SCWM/EX_MFG_STAGE_INFO. ( refer SAP note-3021925 - Dependency for BAdI Implementation Unclear)

Please refer this SAP note - 3529286 - PMR items created with Single-Order Staging method while Cross-Order Staging is expected.

Refer this discussion 

Best regards,

Kannan chokkanathan.

entry.title: ðŸ‡®ðŸ‡³ Getting started with Generative AI Hub on SAP AI Core (Pune, India)
entry.content:
This SAP CodeJam event is on Getting Started with Generative AI Hub on SAP AI Core and Python. You do not need any background in the topic, but you should have a lot of curiosity!

In this CodeJam, you will learn how to use the Generative AI Hub on SAP AI Core to implement retrieval-augmented generation (RAG). This approach improves the responses of large language models (LLMs) and reduces hallucinations. You will learn how to deploy an LLM and the orchestration service on SAP AI Core, and how to query it via SAP AI Launchpad and the Python SDK. Additionally, you will gain insights into key generative AI concepts and learn how to enhance RAG responses.

Location and Date:

This is a free in-person event only (not virtual) and is planned for Tuesday, February 10th, 2026 from 10:00 - 16:30 hrs  local time in Pune, India. The language of the event and the content will be English.

Event Address: 

LTIMindtree,  2nd floor, Building IT-06, Qubix Business Park Private Limited â€“ SEZ, Survey No. 154/6, Rajiv Gandhi Infotech Park, Phase -1, Hinjewadi, Pune, Maharashtra. 411057

Google maps location: https://maps.app.goo.gl/oTR1kJpff7QiCK8p8

The instructors are SAP Developer Advocates @ajay_soreng and @shrinivasan_neelamegam 

The event is kindly hosted by LTIMindtree. Thank you!

Prerequisites: 

  • Bring your own laptop with power adapter and have a supported Web browser such as Google Chrome or Firefox installed on your laptop.

Please note that spaces are limited! We can only accommodate 40 attendees. If you want to attend, register by clicking the Yes button in the Will you be attending? section above to the right. About two weeks before the event, you will be asked to confirm your attendance via email.

For more information on SAP CodeJam events, head over to the SAP CodeJam group.

entry.title: Re: How system make to consider planned delivery time int...
entry.content:
Could you please elaborate on the specific reasons why this solution does not fit? For example, is it due to multiple raw materials with varying lead times, system constraints, or process alignment issues?

In parallel, there are alternate approaches we can consider:

  • Maintain planned delivery times at raw material level so MRP offsets dependent requirements correctly.
  • Use scheduling margin keys or safety time to introduce buffers without inflating GR processing time.
  • Explore PP/DS (Production Planning and Detailed Scheduling) if more granular pegging and scheduling is required.

Once I understand the exact limitation, I can try to assist with the most suitable option that ensures raw material delivery times are properly considered in planned order scheduling.

entry.title: Re: Template not available
entry.content:
In order to submit a service request for these templates, an S-user must have the authorization 'Create Billable Service Requests' at the customer number level. To obtain this required authorization, please contact your administrator (listed under Users & Contacts - SAP for Me) to have the authorization assigned.

For more detailed information on S-user authorizations required the Private Cloud Service Request application, please refer to KBA 2669783 - Required S-user authorizations for the Private Cloud Service Request application - SAP for Me

entry.title: Re: RAP: How to enable/disable a field when entering a va...
entry.content:
For Example:

field ( features : instance ) NRooms;

 will trigger method GET_INSTANCE_FEATURES

RESULT = VALUE #( FOR ENTITY IN LT_BOOKING_RESULT
( %TKY = ENTITY-%TKY
%FEATURES-%FIELD-OTHERFIELD = COND #( WHEN ENTITY-NROOMS = 3 THEN IF_ABAP_BEHV=>FC-O-DISABLED ELSE IF_ABAP_BEHV=>FC-O-DISABLED )
) ).

Use IN LOCAL MODE to read current buffer state. %tky automatically includes all entity key fields to uniquely identify instances in transactional buffer. In above example %FEATURES-%FIELD-OTHERFIELD controls the state of UI elements & ENTITY-NROOMS will contain the new/changed value at runtime.

Regarding, retrigger the features control after determination on modify

determination onMyFieldChange on modify { field NRooms; }

above statement will trigger method GET_INSTANCE_FEATURES first & then determination method onMyFieldChange

entry.title: Re: #CoE#GB Display changes to object no value in SAP Pub...
entry.content:
Hi,

Please check following possible causes and diagnostic steps,

Possible Root Causes

  1. Change Document Configuration Missing: Object types may not have change documents properly activated
  2. App Replacement: The "Display Changes to Object" app may have been deprecated or replaced with newer functionality
  3. Object Type Not Included: Info records and PRs may not be included in the current logging scope
  4. User Authorization Restrictions: Insufficient permissions to view change logs for specific object types
  5. Alternative Change Tracking Method Required: Different apps or methods needed for specific object types
  6. System Configuration Gaps: Event logging activation may not cover all required object types

Diagnostic Steps

  1. Verify Change Document Apps: Check if you're using the correct app - the "Show Change Documents" app (CA_SHOW_CD) is the standard replacement for older change document functionality 
  2. Check Object-Specific Configuration: For info records, verify if change documents are activated for purchasing objects in customizing
  3. Validate App Access: Ensure you have proper authorization to access change document applications
  4. Review Object Type Coverage: Confirm that info records and PRs are included in your system's change document scope
  5. Test with Known Changes: Try viewing change documents for other object types to verify app functionality

 

Best regards,

Yong

entry.title: Architecture Decisions for Product Tracking and Tracing Capability
entry.content:
Summary

When defining a target architecture based on the SAP Reference Business Architecture (RBA), the Product Tracking and Tracing capability under the Supply Chain Enablement domain ensures product identification, serialization, and traceability across manufacturing, warehousing, logistics, and regulatory processes.

SAP Reference Business Architecture lists multiple solutions that support this capability â€”

1. SAP Advanced Track and Trace for Pharmaceuticals (ATTP)

2. SAP Auto-ID Infrastructure (Auto-ID)

3. SAP Corporate Serialization (CS).

This article provides architectural guidance for selecting the most suitable solution based on business requirements, industry regulations, and integration scope.

Business Requirements

The Product Tracking and Tracing capability is defined as the ability to uniquely identify, serialize, and track products through their lifecycle â€” from production to end-customer â€” ensuring compliance, authenticity, and operational visibility.

Key business drivers include:

  • Regulatory compliance (e.g., DSCSA, EU FMD for pharmaceuticals).
  • Country-specific legal requirements on serialization, tracking and tracing and regulatory reporting requirements of pharmaceutical products.
  • Serialization and aggregation at packaging levels.
  • Event-Based Object Tracking and Real-Time Visibility.
  • Tracking events from production, warehousing, transport, and distribution channels.
  • Data capture from IoT devices (e.g., RFID, barcodes).

The target solution must provide a standardized, scalable approach to handle product identification and data exchange across global supply chains.

Solution Options

The following SAP solutions are available to fulfil this capability:

  • SAP Advanced Track and Trace for Pharmaceuticals (ATTP)
  • SAP Auto-ID Infrastructure (Auto-ID)
  • SAP Corporate Serialization (CS)

Characterization of the Solution Options

1. SAP Advanced Track and Trace for Pharmaceuticals (ATTP)

  • Solution built for regulated industries such as pharmaceuticals and life sciences.
  • Provides country-specific legal requirements on serialization, tracking and tracing and regulatory reporting of pharmaceutical products (e.g., US DSCSA, EU FMD, Russia, Brazil, China).
  • Enables integration with packaging lines, Level 3 site systems, and national regulatory hubs.
  • Offers prebuilt interfaces to SAP ICH (Information Collaboration Hub for Life Sciences) for reporting to external authorities.
  • Ideal for compliance-driven serialization where regulatory reporting and verification are mandatory.

Integration Landscape:

SAP ATTP integrates tightly with SAP S/4HANA, SAP Manufacturing Execution (ME), SAP EWM and external line controllers. It leverages SAP BTP for data exchange and partner integrations.

2. SAP Auto-ID Infrastructure (Auto-ID)

  • Provides the foundational IoT framework for managing unique identifiers (e.g., barcodes, RFID, EPCIS events).
  • Tracks physical object movements and states across enterprise systems and locations.
  • Enables event capture and real-time analytics on serialized products.
  • Not limited to pharmaceuticals â€” applicable across industries like Consumer Goods, Automotive, and High Tech for asset tracking, warehouse automation, and IoT-enabled supply chain visibility.
  • Suitable for organizations seeking broader object event management rather than strict regulatory serialization.

Integration Landscape:

SAP Auto-ID Infrastructure is often deployed within SAP Supply Chain Execution or Digital Manufacturing landscapes. It integrates with SAP EWM and SAP Event Management for real-time visibility and object event tracking. In many architectures, it also participates in the broader transportation visibility chain (via EM integration into SAP TM).]

3. SAP Corporate Serialization (CS)

  • Provides a unique identifier repository to track and trace serialized products, ensuring end-to-end visibility across the global supply chain.
  • Manages enterprise-wide serialization data centrally within corporate IT landscapes, consolidating inputs from multiple plants, CMOs, and regional systems.
  • Integrates with SAP ATTP, SAP Auto-ID Infrastructure, and external serialization platforms, enabling seamless data synchronization and compliance oversight.
  • Supports global governance and policy enforcement by harmonizing serialization processes, regulatory data, and master data across sites within a unified compliance framework.
  • Offers centralized control over serialization data and lifecycle events, enhancing traceability, counterfeit prevention, and regulatory adherence.
  • Ideal for large, multi-site enterprises requiring centralized orchestration of serialization data and enterprise-level compliance monitoring.

Integration Landscape:

SAP Corporate Serialization acts as a master serialization repository and often coexists with SAP ATTP or Auto-ID instances in hybrid architectures. 

Criteria to determine the most suitable target solution

The decision on which product to implement for Product Tracking and Tracing depends on the industry context, regulatory scope, and operational maturity of the enterprise.

 

Criteria

SAP ATTP

SAP Auto-ID Infrastructure

SAP Corporate Serialization

Industry Focus

Life Sciences, Pharma

Cross-industry (Consumer Goods, Automotive, High Tech)

Multi-industry / Corporate IT

Primary Purpose

Regulatory compliance and serialization reporting

Object event management and IoT tracking

Centralized serialization master and governance

Compliance Requirement

Mandatory reporting to national authorities

Not compliance-driven

Corporate-level compliance consolidation

Integration Focus

Packaging lines, national hubs, SAP S/4HANA, SAP ICH

EWM, TM, Manufacturing, IoT sensors

ATTP, Auto-ID, external CMO networks

Complexity

High (regulatory + technical)

Moderate

High (multi-system orchestration)

 

Decision Tree

Conclusion

The Product Tracking and Tracing capability is essential for modern supply chains, enabling compliance, visibility, and trust. While SAP S/4HANA remains the operational backbone, the choice among SAP ATTP, SAP Auto-ID Infrastructure and SAP Corporate Serialization depends on:

  • Industry regulatory obligations
  • Scope of serialization or event tracking
  • Scale and governance model

In practice:

  • SAP ATTP is the default choice for regulated industries where compliance and reporting are mandatory.
  • SAP Auto-ID Infrastructure suits organizations focusing on real-time operational visibility.
  • SAP Corporate Serialization becomes critical for large enterprises consolidating multiple serialization environments.

Together, these solutions enable a scalable, compliant, and intelligent traceability architecture across industries â€” ensuring every serialized product can be trusted, tracked, and verified from source to shelf.

entry.title: Inventory Audit Report Performance Issue â€“ Extremely Long Runtime / Timeouts (SAP Business One)
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I am looking for assistance with a performance issue related to the Inventory Audit Report in SAP Business One.

System Landscape

  • SAP Business One Version: 10.0 FP 2405

  • Database: Microsoft SQL Server 2019

  • Database Size: ~57 GB

  • Server OS: Microsoft Windows Server 2019 Standard

  • Server Deployment: Cloud

  • Client Type: SAP Business One Windows Client

Issue Description

The client is experiencing very long execution times when running the standard Inventory Audit Report.

  • The report takes an excessive amount of time to load and frequently times out.

  • This behavior occurs even when running the report for a single day.

  • Due to the long runtime and timeout behavior, the report is effectively unusable.

  • The issue is consistent and reproducible.

Additional Observations

  • No customizations or modifications have been made to the standard Inventory Audit Report.

  • The issue occurs regardless of the user executing the report.

  • Other inventory-related reports execute normally or significantly faster in comparison.

  • Although the database contains historical inventory data, the issue still occurs with very small date ranges.

Business Impact

The Inventory Audit Report is required for:

  • Inventory reconciliation

  • Audit and compliance activities

  • Historical stock movement validation

At this time, the client cannot rely on this report due to the performance limitations.

Request for Assistance

We would appreciate guidance on:

  • Known performance issues with the Inventory Audit Report in SAP Business One 10 FP 2405

  • SAP Notes or known corrections related to this report

  • Recommended configuration or best practices to improve performance

  • Whether this behavior has been addressed in later Feature Packs or patches

Any insights, recommendations, or shared experiences would be highly appreciated.

Thank you

entry.title: BTP ABAP SaaS Solution: Custom Field not available in multitenant solution
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

We are developing a multitenant SaaS application in the BTP ABAP Environment using RAP.

We followed the official documentation for predefined field enablement:
https://help.sap.com/docs/abap-cloud/abap-development-tools-user-guide/working-with-predefined-field-enablings

Scenario:

  • RAP-based business object
  • Interface view marked as extensible
  • Dummy field added as described in the documentation
  • Application deployed in provider tenant
  • On the consumer tenant, a custom field is defined using the Predefined Custom Fields app

Issue:

  • In the "Configure Predefined Custom Fields" app on the consumer system, no services are available for selection in the "Services" section:
  • As a result the custom field can be defined, but the extended field does not appear in the application and is also not available in the Key User Extensibility tools and the metadata.

Implementation details:

  • Interface View Entity
@Metadata.allowExtensions: true
@AbapCatalog.extensibility: {
  extensible: true,
  dataSources: ['Employee']
}
define root view entity /TCON/I_EMPLOYEE
  as select from /tcon/employee as Employee
{
  key uuid      as Uuid,
      firstname as FirstName,
      lastname  as LastName
}
  • View Extension
extend view entity /TCON/I_EMPLOYEE with
{
  Employee./tcon/custom_field_1
}
  • Persistence Include (Dummy Field)
@EndUserText.label : 'Extension structure for Employee'
@AbapCatalog.enhancement.category : #EXTENSIBLE_ANY
define structure /tcon/employee_ext_incl {
  dummy : abap.char(1);
}
â€‹
  • Persistence Extension
extend type /tcon/employee_ext_incl with /tcon/employee_ext_incl_ext {
  /tcon/custom_field_1 : abap.char(1);
}
  • Predefined Field Enabling:
{
 "formatVersion":"1",
 "header":
 {
  "description":"Predefined Field Enabling for CDS entity /TCON/I_EMPLOYEE",
  "masterLanguage":"EN",
  "abapLanguageVersion":"cloudDevelopment"
 },
 "persistence":
 {
  "databaseTable":"/TCON/EMPLOYEE",
  "persistenceInclude":"/TCON/EMPLOYEE_EXT_INCL",
  "persistenceExtension":"/TCON/EMPLOYEE_EXT_INCL_EXT",
  "fieldPrefix":"/tcon/custom"
 },
 "predefinedFields":
 [
  {
   "name":"/tcon/custom_field_1",
   "type":"character",
   "length":1
  }
 ],
 "relatedViewEntities":
 [
  {
   "viewEntity":"/TCON/I_EMPLOYEE",
   "baseObjectAlias":"EMPLOYEE",
   "viewExtension":"/TCON/I_EMPLOYEE_EXT"
  }
 ],
 "serviceConsumptionModels":
 []
}â€‹

Question:

Is predefined field enablement for RAP-based entities supported in multitenant ABAP Environment scenarios (provider/consumer setup)?
If yes, are there additional prerequisites (e.g. service bindings, service consumption models, or extensibility-related annotations) that must be maintained so that services become selectable in the Predefined Custom Fields app?

Any clarification would be highly appreciated.

Kind regards
Johannes

entry.title: Setting up AI-assisted production routing proposals using SAP S/4HANA ISLM
entry.content:
In todayâ€™s blog, I will walk you through the setup of the AI-assisted production routing proposal feature using S/4HANA Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Management (ISLM), a new feature planned to be available with the new 2602 release. If you are not familiar with S/4HANA Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Management (ISLM), I recommend you get a first idea by looking at our Product Help. 

Why AI-Assisted Production Routing Proposals?

This AI feature can help production engineers, production planners, or master data specialists create new production routings more efficiently: In the Manager Routings app, they can use AI to get recommendations of routings that they can copy or reuse, based on BOM similarity.

The scenario is based on the K-nearest neighbors (KNN) algorithm. The intelligent scenario provides three BOMs that are considered most similar to the material and BOM that the user specified to find routings for copying. The system proposes existing production routings that could be used to copy based on the applicability of the production version where that routing and the similar BOM that is predicted by the model are used together. 

The routings that are associated with these similar materials and their BOMs are proposed based on certain factors related to the BOM and the production versions in which these BOMs are used. Proposals are listed based on priority of the following factors:

  1. Validity date of a similar alternative BOM matching the production version that uses the proposed routing.
  2. Lot size of a similar alternative BOM matching the production version that uses the proposed routing.
  3. Production version having the maximum number of production orders.

Users can select a match to display and verify the related routings. They can then choose the most suitable routing from the proposed list, copy it and use it as a template for their new routing.

During this process, the AI feature helps to minimize the time spent on repetitive data entry and reduces the risk of errors. If you want to find out more about the AI-assisted routing proposals, please check out Intelligent Scenario to Find Similar Materials for Routing Proposal and Create a Routing using the AI-Assisted Material Search in the SAP Help Portal (content available as of 14 Jan, 2026).

So whatâ€™s SAP Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Management (ISLM) to do with it?

What Is ISLM: Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Management is a standardized framework for building and managing AI use cases within SAP Cloud ERP for both embedded and side-by-side scenarios. It can be leveraged to perform lifecycle operations, including Scheduled Training and Retraining, and deployment of the model directly within SAP Cloud ERP.

The ISLM framework consists of two SAP Fiori applications, the Intelligent Scenarios app (App ID F4469) and the Intelligent Scenario Management app (App ID F4470). These two applications provide a unified interface for creating, deploying,  monitoring, and activating the model directly within SAP Cloud ERP.

The Intelligent Scenarios app is used to create, display, and configure various scenarios tailored to specific business needs. Using this app, you can view a list and activate SAP provided standard scenarios or create Embedded or Side-by-Side scenarios. 

For detailed information on ISLM, including its architecture of and how to set up an ISLM scenario, please refer to this blog post.

Now, let us use the SAP provided ISLM scenario "FIND_SIMBOMROUTINGV3" and take a look at the input and output fields used by the model. This predefined intelligent scenario allows you, as a user assigned with the business role Analytics Specialist (SAP_BR_ANALYTICS_SPECIALIST), to enable users to use the AI-assisted production routing proposal feature.

Note

Make sure to enable turnkey and review its schedule for the intelligent scenario to automate the prerequisites check, train, deployment, and run the activation. The calendar for the turnkey schedule is set to International, by default. For more information, see Turnkey (content available as of 14 Jan, 2026).

Fields
BOM and material-specific fields are provided in a flattened format to the model. The fields of the input material are compared with the fields provided to the model in order to find similar materials in the Manage Routing app. A maximum of 5000 characters in flattened format is allowed for each column that can be provided to the model. Output fields contain the results generated by the ML model after it is trained. These output fields provide the predictions and related metrics back to the business application. You can find a complete list of all fields here (content available as of 14 Jan, 2026).

Publication and Training

Once you have checked the fields, you can publish the scenario. After successfully publishing the ISLM scenario, you can move on to the Intelligent Scenario Management app to train the model and schedule it. The Intelligent Scenario Management app is used to manage, monitor,  and optimize AI driven scenarios throughout their entire lifecycle. 

Prerequisites Check

The recommended prerequisite check for the scenario "FIND_SIMBOMROUTINGV3" is 90 records, the minimum is 50 records.

Following the successful training, the system provides statistical information on variables and performance of the model. The model version report screen provides a summary about a particular model version. The quality information details varies according to the intelligent scenario type and underlying machine learning used.

For  a general introduction to  Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Management (ISLM), see Introduction to Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Management(ISLM).

If you want to gain deeper understanding of SAP Signavio Process Manager & Process Collaboration Hub, dive into this blog post on SAP Signavio : The nuts and bolts of a well-thought-out SAP Signavio : Process Manager & Process Collaboration Hub.

Thanks for reading! Donâ€™t hesitate to leave a comment and check out our community page to ask your questions and engage with the experts. Follow the PSCC_Enablement tag to stay up to date with our latest blog posts. 

Follow me on LinkedIn and stay up-to-date with our latest enablement assets: linkedin.com/in/annette-garcia-lorenzo

entry.title: Creating ServiceOrder via I_SERVICEORDERTP
entry.content:
Hi,

I am creating Serviceorders via I_SERVICEORDERTP.

Im using basically the example code thats given in the documentation.

DATA: lt_order_to_create            TYPE TABLE FOR CREATE i_serviceordertp,
          lt_item_to_create_cba         TYPE TABLE FOR CREATE i_serviceordertp\_serviceorderitemtp,
          ls_item_to_create_cba         LIKE LINE OF lt_item_to_create_cba,
          lt_item_target                LIKE ls_item_to_create_cba-%target,
          lt_refobj_to_create_cba       TYPE TABLE FOR CREATE i_serviceordertp\_srvcordreferenceobjecttp,
          ls_refobj_to_create_cba       LIKE LINE OF lt_refobj_to_create_cba,
          lt_refobj_target              LIKE ls_refobj_to_create_cba-%target,
          lt_priceelement_to_create_cba TYPE TABLE FOR CREATE i_serviceordertp\_srvcordpriceelementtp,
          ls_priceelement_to_create_cba LIKE LINE OF lt_priceelement_to_create_cba,
          lt_priceelement_target        LIKE ls_priceelement_to_create_cba-%target,
          lt_item_refobj_cba            TYPE TABLE FOR CREATE i_serviceorderitemtp\_srvcorditemreferenceobjecttp,
          ls_item_refobj_cba            LIKE LINE OF lt_item_refobj_cba,
          lt_item_refobj_target         LIKE ls_item_refobj_cba-%target,
          lt_priceitem_cba              TYPE TABLE FOR CREATE i_serviceorderitemtp\_srvcorditempriceelementtp,
          ls_priceitem_cba              LIKE LINE OF lt_priceitem_cba,
          lt_priceitem_cba_target       LIKE ls_priceitem_cba-%target.

    INSERT VALUE #( %cid = 'CID_HDR'
                    serviceordertype     = 'SRVO'
                    serviceorderdescription = 'Service Order using EML'
                    language                = 'E'

                    salesorganization       = '1010'
                    division                = '00'
                    distributionchannel     = '10'
                    %control = VALUE #( serviceordertype        = cl_abap_behv=>flag_changed
                                        serviceorderdescription = cl_abap_behv=>flag_changed
                                        language                = cl_abap_behv=>flag_changed
                                        soldtoparty             = cl_abap_behv=>flag_changed
                                        salesorganization       = cl_abap_behv=>flag_changed
                                        division                = cl_abap_behv=>flag_changed
                                        distributionchannel     = cl_abap_behv=>flag_changed )
                  ) INTO TABLE lt_order_to_create.

    INSERT VALUE #( %cid = 'CID_ITEM'
                    product  = 'SRV_01'
                    quantity = '1'
                  ) INTO TABLE lt_item_target.

    IF lt_item_target IS NOT INITIAL.
      INSERT  VALUE #( %cid_ref = 'CID_HDR'

                     ) INTO TABLE lt_item_to_create_cba.

    INSERT VALUE #( %cid  = 'CID_HDR_REFOBJ'
                    servicereferenceequipment = '000000000010000009' ) INTO TABLE lt_refobj_target.


    IF lt_refobj_target IS NOT INITIAL.
      INSERT  VALUE #( %cid_ref = 'CID_HDR'
                       %target  = lt_refobj_target
                      ) INTO TABLE lt_refobj_to_create_cba.
    ENDIF.

    INSERT VALUE #( %cid  = 'CID_HDR_PRICEELE'

                    conditionratevalue = '45'
                    conditioncurrency = 'EUR' ) INTO TABLE lt_priceelement_target.

    IF lt_priceelement_target IS NOT INITIAL.
      INSERT  VALUE #( %cid_ref = 'CID_HDR'
                       %target  = lt_priceelement_target
                     ) INTO TABLE lt_priceelement_to_create_cba.
    ENDIF.

    INSERT VALUE #( %cid  = 'CID_ITEM_REFOBJ'
                    servicereferenceequipment = '000000000010000009' ) INTO TABLE lt_item_refobj_target.

    IF lt_item_refobj_target IS NOT INITIAL.

                      %target  = lt_priceitem_cba_target ) INTO TABLE lt_priceitem_cba.
    ENDIF.

    MODIFY ENTITIES OF i_serviceordertp
     ENTITY serviceorder
       CREATE FROM lt_order_to_create
       CREATE BY \_serviceorderitemtp FROM lt_item_to_create_cba
       CREATE BY \_srvcordreferenceobjecttp FROM lt_refobj_to_create_cba
       CREATE BY \_srvcordpriceelementtp FROM lt_priceelement_to_create_cba
     ENTITY serviceorderitem
       CREATE BY \_srvcorditemreferenceobjecttp FROM lt_item_refobj_cba
       CREATE BY \_srvcorditempriceelementtp   FROM lt_priceitem_cba
         MAPPED DATA(mapped_modify)
         FAILED DATA(failed_modify)
         REPORTED DATA(reported_modify).

    COMMIT ENTITIES
      RESPONSE OF i_serviceordertp
      FAILED DATA(failed_commit)
      REPORTED DATA(reported_commit).

 

The Serviceorders are created with an error. The "EnterpriseServiceOrg" field is not set. The EnterpriseServiceOrg field is missing in the corresponging table ( lt_order_to_create ). 

My Question:

Thanks

entry.title: NSE on HANA cloud instance for SAP Datasphere
entry.content:
Hi Experts, 

We have implemented NSE on HANA Cloud instance. However, with increased use of Datasphere, we were hoping to implement the same on Datasphere. As datasphere has its own instance of Hana cloud, can we not impleement the same? 

If yes, how do we get access to this instance?

entry.title: Re: Project settlement issue
entry.content:
Why the error is coming because, settlement can be defined per ledger. If no ledger group is specified, the system cannot determine where to post. If your system uses multiple ledgers (e.g., IFRS and local GAAP), settlement requires explicit ledger assignment. The settlement profile or distribution rule may not have a ledger group maintained, leading to the error message.

Follow the below steps to resolve

Check Settlement Profile
Go to the settlement profile assigned to your project type. Ensure that ledger-specific settlement rules are activated if parallel ledgers are in use. Check this SAP Help Ledger-Specific Settlement Rules 

Maintain Ledger Group in Settlement Rule
Open the project settlement rule. Enter the ledger group (e.g., 0L for leading ledger, or a specific ledger group if parallel ledgers are active). If left blank, the rule applies to all ledgers without specific treatment.

Verify Distribution Rules
Ensure the distribution rule (e.g., settlement to asset, cost center, or profitability segment) has the correct ledger group maintained.

Run Settlement Again
After maintaining the ledger group, re-run the settlement. The system should now post correctly to the specified ledger(s).

entry.title: Re: SAPUI5 Rich Text Editor Custom File & Image Upload Handler
entry.content:
Hi @wridgeu ,

Thanks for the question!

Generally while we work on such text editors, we intend to insert the image at the placeholder for better visualisation and context of the text through drag & drop or paste functionality, whereas for any attachment files we would tend to add it as a link placeholder by selecting the file.

Hence, I had made the Upload File (attachment) action to handle both images (yes, image is still an attachment here) & files, whereas the images upload handler to handle the paste or drag & drop functionality which would add the image inline at the placeholder.

if you can add ODBC-Entry of SQL Anywhere 17 on the client, this means that the clients have SQL-Anywhere installed.

entry.title: Re: SAP B1 SP 2411, how to log in as different user
entry.content:
This might be a brute force solution, but I am not aware of anything simpler. I use one of two options:

1. If B1 is installed on some virtual server, you can create and login with a new user that is not binded to B1 user. In this case, the system will ask you for credentials.

2. You can unbind your current user in SLD, which will also result in the system asking you for credentials.

entry.title: Re: Leveraging ADBC for High-Performance HANA Operations in ABAP
entry.content:
ADBC is available since ABAP 6.10 (not 7.40) and documented since 7.02.

ADBC is not limited to HANA.

ABAP SQL (new name of Open SQL) may be used instead of ADBC for using a secondary database and for executing HANA-optimized SQL or procedures.

ADBC can be used for direct access to any database, for using the database features which are not available via ABAP SQL.

ABAP 7.58 Documentation: ADBC

NB: ADBC is obsolete in ABAP 9.16, I guess that it's for the Cloud and the programming is via a Cloud service? (no idea why then ABAP 8.16 introduces a new AMDP feature...)

entry.title: Legal Change - IDIS scenario support through Extensibility in DRC TÃ¼rkiye
entry.content:
This blog post provides a step-by-step guide on how to implement the new legal requirement released by GIB (GELÄ°R Ä°DARESÄ° BAÅžKANLIÄžI) for eInvoice and eDespatch under the Construction Rebar Tracking System (IDIS) using Developer Extensibility for Document and Reporting Compliance TÃ¼rkiye in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud.

Background:
We have already published a blog titled Developer Extensibility for Document and Reporting Compliance TÃ¼rkiye in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud which explains how SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud customers can leverage developer extensibility to modify the content of XML files generated during electronic invoice submissions, in accordance with specific business and legal requirements.

Note for SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud and ECC environments:
In SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud and SAP ECC environments, the same extensibility approach is available. However, in these systems, the BAdI implementation must be carried out for EDOC_ADAPTOR instead of EDOC_ADAPTOR_CLOUD.

Whatâ€™s New?
GIB has published a legal requirement for invoices issued under the Construction Rebar Tracking System, which impacts certain companies starting from 21st November 2025. In this blog, we aim to address this requirement by building on the learnings from the previous blog highlighted in the background.

What are the technical specifications of the requirement?
Currently, the system does not automatically determine whether a billing or finance document is related to the Construction Rebar Tracking  System. Customers must explicitly indicate that the invoice belongs to a Construction Rebar Tracking System and provide the required values.
As part of the legal requirements published by the authorities, the following new Profile IDs must be used in the UBL (Universal Business Language, an ISO standard XML) representation:

  1. IDIS - for eInvoice Scenarios
  2. IDISIRSALIYE â€“ for eDespatch scenarios

eInvoice

  • ProfileID for IDIS Scenario
    For IDIS-relevant invoices, the ProfileID in the UBL-TR XML will be set to IDIS.
    • Cardinality: 1 (Mandatory)
    • This value determines that the invoice belongs to the IDIS scenario
    • The solution will automatically populate this value for applicable

  • Shipment Number (Sevkiyat NumarasÄ±) at Header Level:
    • Mapped to: Invoice/AccountingSupplierParty/Party/PartyIdentification
      SE-<number> with schemeID as SEVKIYATINO â€“ This would carry the shipment number prefixed with SE. The total number of characters is 10.
      Example: SE-1345840
    • IssueDate should be filled with the investment certificate date in DD/MM/YYYY format

  • Tag Number (Etiket NumarasÄ±) at Item Level:
    • Invoice/InvoiceLine/Item/AdditionalItemIdentification/ID should be filled with tag number generated within the scope of IDIS (Rebar Monitoring System). This number is a 9-character alphanumeric value, where the first 2 characters are letters followed by 7 numeric digits. 
      SchemeID should be ETIKETNO.
      Example: CV0152457

eDespatch

  • ProfileID for IDISIRSALIYE Scenario
    For IDISIRSALIYE-relevant invoices, the ProfileID in the UBL-TR XML will be set to IDISIRSALIYE.
    • Cardinality: 1 (Mandatory)
    • This value determines that the invoice belongs to the IDISIRSALIYE scenario
    • The solution will automatically populate this value for applicable

  • Shipment Number (Sevkiyat NumarasÄ±) at Header Level:
    • Mapped to: /DespatchAdvice/DespatchSupplierParty/Party/PartyIdentification
      SE-<number> with schemeID as SEVKIYATINO â€“ This would carry the shipment number prefixed with SE. The total number of characters is 10.
      Example: SE-1345840
    • IssueDate should be filled with the investment certificate date in DD/MM/YYYY format

  • Tag Number (Etiket NumarasÄ±) at Item Level:
    • /DespatchAdvice/DespatchLine/Item/AdditionalItemIdentification/ID should be filled with tag number generated within the scope of IDIS (Rebar Monitoring System). This number is a 9-character alphanumeric value, where the first 2 characters are letters followed by 7 numeric digits. 
      SchemeID should be ETIKETNO.
      Example: CV0152457

Result:
When you display the XML file of the electronic document in theâ€¯eDocument Cockpitâ€¯(EDOC_COCKPIT) corresponding to the above invoicing scenario, you will see that the mentioned tags are populated accordingly. Please note that any error handling and troubleshooting will depend on the actual submission of this document to the authorized service provider.

Conclusion:
With recent enhancements to the TÃ¼rkiye Document and Reporting Compliance solution, SAP has made it significantly easier to tailor electronic document outputs.
This improvement gives you more flexibility and helps ensure compliance with TÃ¼rkiyeâ€™s legal requirements.
